data.description: If you’re looking for a meaningful career, you’ll find it here at Webster. Founded in 1935, our focus has always been to put people first--doing whatever we can to help individuals, families, businesses and our colleagues achieve their financial goals. As a leading commercial bank, we remain passionate about serving our clients and supporting our communities. Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Agility, Respect, Excellence are Webster’s values, these set us apart as a bank and as an employer.  Come join our team where you can expand your career potential, benefit from our robust development opportunities, and enjoy meaningful work!Data Engineering InternIf you're looking for an exciting opportunity to gain real-world work experience, Webster Bank's internship program delivers! High performing students entering their junior or senior year of undergraduate studies will have the opportunity to work side-by-side with Webster/HSA colleagues to gain valuable experience, knowledge, and skills. This internship program is designed to create a pipeline of candidates who may become Webster’s next generation of leaders.As an intern at Webster Bank/HSA Bank, you will experience an unforgettable summer of learning, networking, and fun, while gaining valuable experience that directly complements classroom studies. Every internship opportunity is structured to provide you with a meaningful experience, broad exposure to our corporate functions, and opportunities for mentorship and networking. Webster's internship will be demanding & rewarding, and prepare you for your career ahead.  Summer Intern Program duration: June 1 – August 7, 2026.IT Summer Internship – Data EngineeringParticipate in systems analysis and design working sessions.Develop data flow diagrams based on understanding of systems.Work with the teams to gather details on new system design and data integration processes.Analyze data sets to identify patterns and insights.Perform basic python programming for processing data sets.Work with teams across the org to fulfil ad hoc process/report requests.Write SQL statements to extract data for reportingLocation:  Stamford, CTParticipation Benefits Include:Networking and social events with other internsOpportunities to meet with business professionals, leaders and early career professionalsMentor assigned to help guide your experience at Webster Bank/HSA BankFuture opportunities to interview for full-time positions post-graduationEducation, Skills, and Experience Requirements for Interns:Current undergraduate rising Junior or Senior enrolled in an accredited college or university who is pursuing a degree in related field and has an interest in the banking/financial services industryResourceful, enthusiastic, and proactiveHighly organizedDemonstrated strong attention to detailExperience creating and delivering presentationsStrong written and verbal communication skillsSelf-motivated with a strong work ethicAbility to learn quickly and solve problemsStrong analytical skillsCollaborative and inclusive team playerProficient in Word, Excel, PowerPointLegally eligible to work in the U.S.The estimated hourly range for this position is $21.00/hour USD to $23.00/hour USD. Actual salary may vary up or down depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.#LI-FO1#LI-HybridWebster Financial Corporation and its subsidiaries (“Webster”) are equal opportunity employers that are committed to sustaining an inclusive environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
requirements: Current undergraduate rising Junior or Senior enrolled in an accredited college or university who is pursuing a degree in related field and has an interest in the banking/financial services industry
responsibilities: Develop data flow diagrams based on understanding of systems.
